definition[0]: a collection of things that someone hides somewhere, especially so they can use them later
example[0]: the discovery of a hoard of gold coins
definition[1]: to collect and save large amounts of food, money etc, especially when it is not necessary to do so
example[1]: families who hoarded food during the strike
definition[2]: to collect and save large amounts of something in order to sell it later at a high price or because you think there might not be enough available in the future
example[2]: Banks must be discouraged from hoarding dollars.
example[3]: He accused big companies of hoarding available stocks of grain.
definition[3]: a store of money or goods kept to be used or sold in the future
example[4]: The company has a large cash hoard.
